title: Blender 3D...
content: Probably because I'm 11 and have a brain the size of a peanut, but how the heck do you use Blender 3D? I've read the tutorial, but it makes completely no sense to me. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dead.gif[/img]

title: Re: Blender 3D...
content: Walk your way through [url=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Blender_3D:_Noob_to_Pro]this tutorial[/url]. If it doesn't make sense to you, then I doubt anyone here will be able to explain it to you in a way that you can understand.

title: Re: Blender 3D...
content:
I never figured out how to use it, either.
Hopefully that tutorial can help me... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-shikadi.gif[/img] -Genius314

title: Re: Blender 3D...
content: Blender is a 3d modeling program, meaning you use it to model things. Therefore, it seems confusing that you would ask him what program he uses after acknowledging that he uses Blender.[center]<font color="MAROON">TOUGH GUYS DON'T FOLLOW FADS</font>[/center]

title: Re: Blender 3D...
content:
There are many other modelling programs out there (but not restricted to just modelling), like Wings3D, Milkshape 3D, Strata, Blender, 3D Studio Max, Maya, etc...just to name a few.

So I am asking him if he has used any other modelling program than Blender. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img]

title: Re: Blender 3D...
content: Ah, I get it now. The way you said it was still kind of ambiguous, though.[center]<font color="MAROON">TOUGH GUYS DON'T FOLLOW FADS</font>[/center]

Well, I've made a pie, a snowman, and a soccer ball... It stinks so no use in saving it. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-redeyes.gif[/img]

I'm going to keep trying, the tutorial is pretty good.

Well, I've worked with Anim8or, so I know how to make stuff in 3D. All I really needed to know were the controls.
Now I can make stuff... although not very well...-Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: Re: : (
content:
@BP

I'd keep those models, it will show you how far you've progressed, and it will be fun going back and looking at your first models.

Well the reason I asked about Blender, is because I'd suggest Wings 3D to start with if you're new to modelling in general, it's an awesome program in my opinion. Blender is really hard to learn from and Wings has a better interface so you can get better accustomed to the whole modelling scene.

Though it seems you're doing well already, from what you said.

@Genius314
Yeah that's really the trick about modelling, once you learn how to model well, all you really need to know is interfaces and you can pretty much transfer your experience from program to program.

title: Re: : (
content:
Doing the noob to pro tutorial is a must. Keep in mind that you're not just learning Blender. You're also learning 3d modeling, which is every bit as hard as learning to draw in 2d. Part of the trouble you will have has less to do with your tools than it does with your experience.________________
